resources.string: Enter the number of total driving hours that your state requires to take the driver license test:
Enter the number of day driving hours that your state requires: (Enter 0 if there is no requirement.)
Enter the number of night driving hours that your state requires: (Enter 0 if there is no requirement.)
Please add the driver that accompanied you by tapping the plus sign in the bottom right, and tapping "Add Driver"
Was this driving done at night?
Unable to export using the Maine format: could not save the PDF.
Unable to export log using the Maine format: an app that can open PDFs is required.
Unable to export log manually: an app that can open XLS files (i.e. spreadsheets) is required.
Welcome to Permit Log, the app that helps drivers with learner\'s permits record their driving hours!\n\nPlease view this tutorial in portrait mode.
Tap the orange button to add a new supervising driver or to manually enter a drive.
Before each drive, select the driver that is supervising you here.
Then, tap the "Start Drive" button to start the timer.
When you\'re done driving, tap the "Stop Drive" button to stop the timer and the app will record the drive in the driving log.

Tap the menu button in upper-left corner to edit and export the driving log, edit info about the supervising drivers, and set your goals.

We hope you enjoy using Permit Log! And remember, don't use your phone while driving.
-Team Redundancy Team

You will now be redirected to a page where you can set your goals. It is recommended that the goals you set are according to your state\'s requirements for getting a driver\'s license, such as how Maine requires 70 hours total and 10 hours at night. While setting your goals is strongly recommended, it is optional and you do not have to set any goals to continue using the app.
Please connect to the Internet and come back to this app to sign in.
For some reason, authentication failed. Please try again.
